igt.tag-types: L+EX B B M M M M M M M M M B B M B G T

tier.item: See for instance Sigurðsson 1989 (p. 198 ff.), Jónsson 1997-1998 and Jónsson 1998. Jónsson 1998
contains a list of around 690 non-passive predicates that take a non-nominative subject, but many of
them are `complex' in the sense that they enter into more than one quirky construction (i.e. the number
of quirky constructions is considerably higher). In addition, many passives take a non-nominative
subject. Importantly, also, certain quirky constructions are productive and thus cannot really be listed.
Mediopassives or `middles' in -st are for instance not treated as a special predicate type, a disputable
